DOC.brief_summary: This study examine feasibility acceptability web-based intervention program woman anxiety childbirth , potential anxiety reduction intervention determine feasibility study design ( randomize control design ) recruitment intervention population inform protocol ( include effect size study power ) randomize control trial .
DOC.brief_title: Website-Based Self-Help Women With Anxiety After Childbirth
DOC.detailed_description: Background : What Am I Worried About ( WAWA ) self-help booklet intervention woman experience anxiety birth base cognitive-behavioural mindfulness principle develop Australia . The WAWA booklet find acceptable , safe , stigma free , feasible , demonstrate preliminary efficacy Australia . A web-based version WAWA use United-Kingdom ( UK ) develop City University London collaboration intervention development team Australia . However , dissemination web-based version WAWA ( iWAWA ) UK deem important evaluate program . Therefore , study aim examine feasibility , acceptability , potential efficacy web-based intervention program woman anxiety childbirth UK . The primary objective propose study : conduct randomize control trial - examine feasibility web-based treatment program ( iWAWA ) term engagement usability . - examine user 's acceptability iWAWA term usefulness , satisfaction , credibility . The secondary objective study : - obtain initial estimate anxiety level examine potential patient improvement course intervention compare control group . - determine feasibility study examine recruitment , consent , attrition , follow-up rate , well response rate questionnaire . Method : For feasibility study , embed mixed method design employ utilizing quantitative qualitative method achieve state aim . For quantitative part , randomize control trial conduct . Outcomes assess pre-intervention , throughout intervention , post-intervention , 1-month post-intervention . For qualitative part , semi-structured interview use in-depth exploration acceptability feasibility iWAWA intervention . The interviews participant carry post intervention . Study benefit : Based participant ' feedback , study hope inform development adaptation investigate web-based intervention . If intervention acceptability feasibility confirm , next step would test intervention efficacy stage II randomize control trial .
DOC.criteria: Women within first 12 month postpartum ( begin intervention ) Aged 18 Living England Sufficient knowledge write spoken English Access internet home Report score ≥5 Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale ( GAD7 ; Spitzer , Kroenke , Williams , & Löwe , 2006 ) Still birth perinatal death late baby Latest baby seriously ill Report selfharm suicidal ideation Currently receive formal psychotherapy
